name: IP Address
description: A unique identifier assigned to each device connected to a network, used to identify and communicate with other devices on the network.

name: DNS
description: A system that translates human-readable domain names (like www.example.com) into IP addresses that computers can understand.

name: Router
description: A device that connects multiple networks together and routes data packets between them. Routers are used to manage traffic on the internet and within local networks.

name: Firewall
description: A security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predefined security rules. Firewalls can be hardware devices or software applications.

name: Protocol
description: A set of rules and procedures used to govern communication between devices on a network. Common protocols include TCP/IP, HTTP, and FTP.

name: Switch
description: A device that connects multiple devices on a local network and forwards data packets between them. Switches are used to manage traffic within a network and improve network performance.

name: Gateway
description: A device that connects a local network to another network, typically the internet. Gateways are used to manage traffic between networks and provide access to external resources.

name: Bandwidth
description: The amount of data that can be transmitted over a network in a given amount of time. Bandwidth is typically measured in bits per second (bps) or bytes per second (Bps).

name: Latency
description: The amount of time it takes for a data packet to travel from one device to another on a network. Latency is typically measured in milliseconds (ms) and can affect the speed and responsiveness of network applications.

name: TCP/IP
description: A suite of protocols used to govern communication on the internet and many other networks. TCP/IP includes protocols for data transmission, addressing, and routing.
